result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin A Budzien was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Injury by Negligent Use/Weapon/Explosive, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.24(1).
  • Injury by Negligent Use/Weapon/Explosive, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.24(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution ordered in the amount of $163.398.12, but is held open for thirty (30) days. Restitution is subject to the Defendant's right to challenge.
-----------------------------------
AMENDMENT: Pursuant to the Restitution Hearing held on 10-5-2015 and the ORDER adopting Findings of Fact and Conclusions of Law filed 11-5-2015 and upon stipulation of the parties, the court awards restitution to victim B.M.J. in the amount of $3,893.77, to the Wisconsin Crime Victim Compensation Fund in the amount of $2,174.72, and to the Wisconsin Physicians Service Insurance Corporation in the amount of $155,078.54 totaling restitution to $161,147.03. Based on N.B.K.'s failure to appear, restitution for N.B.K. is set at zero.
Court finds Defendant has the ability to pay $6,000.00 (money in attorney trust account) towards the restitution  within 30 days of the Amended Judgment of Conviction. Additionally, the Court finds that the Defendant has the ability to pay $250.00 per month towards restitution unless otherwise directed by his Probation Agent or ordered by the Court.
-----------------------------
*AMENDMENT 7/18/2018 - Per 7/12/2018 Probation Review Hearing, civil judgment to be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) on restitution ; Clerk is directed to docket said judgment without fee: 

Wisconsin Physician Service - $154,511.95
1717 W. Broadway
PO Box 8190
Madison, WI 53708
-----------------------------------------------

Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
-----------------------------------

No contact with the victims without the victims' and Agent's consent.  No alcohol.
-----------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
-----------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
-----------------------------------

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges to commence on or before July 24, 2015 @ 8:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Memo from DOC re: Petition for Civil Judgment
Order for Termination of Probation

9:36 am  Court in session.  Defendant Kevin A Budzien in court with attorney James Duquette for Atty Ashley Renz.  Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent Heide Block appears on behalf of DOC.  It was thought that there had been a payment by the insurance company to the insurance company victim.  They have received $566.69 in payments and are owed 154511.95 *Wisconsin Physicians Service".  Atty Wiedenfeld is asking that probation be extended.  Response by Agent Block as to who has been paid.  Victim and crime victim compensation have been paid off.  It is just the insurance company that has not been paid in full.  Agent believes deft has made a good faith effort.  He has complied with his other conditions of probation.  9:40 am  Atty Duquette indicates their position is that defendant has made a good faith effort and should be allowed to discharge from probation at this time.  9:43 am  Response by Atty Wiedenfeld.  State is in compliance with victims rights.  There are no victims present today.  9:43 am  Court makes record.  Court will terminate probation effective today.  Court will enter a civil judgment to Wisconsin Physician Service for $154,511.95.  Attorney Duquette will prepare an Order that probation is terminated today and Court will enter a civil judgment.  9:45 am  Court in recess.
Probation review hearing on July 12, 2018 at 08:30 am.
Email to Probation Agent Block forwarding copy of DA's June 18 letter and advising that probation review hearing has been scheduled
Probation review hearing on July 12, 2018 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Letter from DOC enclosing Petition re: civil judgment/extension
Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing

8:30 am  PROBATION REVIEW HEARING:  
Case called at 8:39 am.  
DA Zeke Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Probation Agent Heidi Block is present.  
Defendant Kevin A Budzien in court with Atty Ashley L Renz.  
Matter is before the Court for a probation review hearing.  
Defendant's probation is due to discharge and he has outstanding restitution.  
Court makes record as to the restitution amounts owed. 
Agent Block indicates it appears that the victim has been paid and the insurance company has also been paid.  Ms. Block advises that he does still owe $17,000 in court obligations.  She states he has done well on probation.  Atty Dept. is requesting that he be allowed to discharge in July.  
8:42 am  Response by Atty Renz as to documents she has that reflect amounts that have been paid.  There was a settlement with home owner and insurance company but they have not been able to get documents to prove payment.  8:44 am  Atty Wiedenfeld has no information from the insurance company with regard to payment.  Atty Wiedenfeld proposes extending probation but allowing it to terminate as soon as there is verification of full payment.  Court asks Atty Wiedenfeld to contact the insurance company and advise them that probation will  expire unless they provide proof that they have not been paid.  Atty Renz asks that his probation be allowed to expire in July if there is no response from victim.  Court will extend probation for 6 weeks from July 9th.  Court will extend probation until end of August - August 31st.  State can stay in touch with DOC and Atty Renz.  If State hears nothing from insurance company, Mr. Budzien can discharge from probaton on August 31st.  If restitution is determined to be taken care of, the Court will enter civil judgment for unpaid court obligations.  8:48 am  court in recess.
Probation review hearing on June 8, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin A Budzien in court with attorney Ashley L Renz.   Court in session at 10:14 am.  Defendant Kevin Budzien appears in Court with Attorney Ashley Renz. Restitution set at zero for N.B.K. Court takes recess to have parties discuss matter regarding WPS restitution request.

10:42 am  Evidence closed.
10:42 am  Argument by Attorney Renz.

Court in recess. Minutes filed.

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.   Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH B.J. OR N.K. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant Kevin A Budzien in court with attorney Ashley L Renz.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
